message.content:
Step 1: Calculate Debt to Asset Ratio.
• From the balance sheet, the liabilities are given as “Total Current Liabilities”: 8,028,630.43.
• Total Assets are given as: 39,772,748.32.
• Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets = 8,028,630.43 / 39,772,748.32 ≈ 0.202 which we round to 0.20.

Step 2: Calculate Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio.
• From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities is –10,442,735.47.
• From the income statement, the Net Profit (Net Income) is 3,744,117.89.
• Ratio = Operating Cash Flow / Net Income = –10,442,735.47 / 3,744,117.89 ≈ –2.79.

Thus, the final answer is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.20",
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "-2.79"
  }
}
